title: River

properties.name: description
properties.value: Rivers are geographical features in Gielinor that flow water from one place to another. They serve many purposes, including transportation via canoes, and a variety of fly fishing spots. Rivers are often the borders between different regions of Gielinor, and play vital roles in some quests. There are sometimes agility shortcuts like stepping stones and log balances that can be used to cross the rivers.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:River

Rivers are geographical features in Gielinor that flow water from one place to another. They serve many purposes, including transportation via canoes, and a variety of fly fishing spots. Rivers are often the borders between different regions of Gielinor, and play vital roles in some quests. There are sometimes agility shortcuts like stepping stones and log balances that can be used to cross the rivers.

Named rivers[edit | edit source]

  • River Dougne, the river running from Baxtorian Falls through East Ardougne and Castle Wars.
  • River Elid, the river that flows through the Kharidian Desert to the Southern Sea.
  • River Hos, the river flowing through Hosidius splitting in two along the way.
  • River Kelda, dividing the city Keldagrim.
  • River Lum, the river flowing from a small spring in the deep Wilderness through Edgeville, the Barbarian Village and Lumbridge.
  • River Molch, the river flowing from Mount Quidamortem, running through the Kebos lowland and Lake Molch.
  • River Salve, the river bordering Misthalin and Morytania
  • River of Souls, the river that transports souls to the Underworld.

rawContent:
{{external|rs}}
'''Rivers''' are geographical features in [[Gielinor]] that flow water from one place to another. They serve many purposes, including transportation via [[canoe]]s, and a variety of [[Fly fishing rod|fly]] [[fishing spots]]. Rivers are often the borders between different regions of [[Gielinor]], and play vital roles in some quests. There are sometimes [[agility shortcut]]s like stepping stones and log balances that can be used to cross the rivers.

==Named rivers==
*[[River Dougne]], the river running from [[Baxtorian Falls]] through [[East Ardougne]] and [[Castle Wars]].
*[[River Elid]], the river that flows through the [[Kharidian Desert]] to the [[Southern Sea]].
*[[River Hos]], the river flowing through [[Hosidius]] splitting in two along the way.
*[[River Kelda]], dividing the city [[Keldagrim]].
*[[River Lum]], the river flowing from a small spring in the deep [[Wilderness]] through [[Edgeville]], the [[Barbarian Village]] and [[Lumbridge]].
*[[River Molch]], the river flowing from [[Mount Quidamortem]], running through the [[Kebos lowland]] and [[Lake Molch]].
*[[River Salve]], the river bordering [[Misthalin]] and [[Morytania]]
*[[River of Souls]], the river that transports souls to the Underworld.
